main_definition: To make a copy or duplicate of something, such as an artwork, document, sound recording, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To create a physical or digital copy of an object or material
meanings_and_examples.example: The museum reproduced the famous painting using high-quality printing techniques.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To generate or produce offspring through sexual reproduction
meanings_and_examples.example: Many animals, such as fish and frogs, are capable of reproducing naturally in their habitats.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To recreate a sound recording by making a duplicate or copy
meanings_and_examples.example: The radio station was able to reproduce the original live performance for its listeners.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make an exact replica of something, such as a design or blueprint
meanings_and_examples.example: The architect reproduced the floor plan in detail so that builders could easily follow it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To broadcast or distribute (a television program, radio show, etc.) again at a later time or date
meanings_and_examples.example: The news channel decided to reproduce an important interview for viewers who missed the original airing.
